intro: Armeriastrum longiflorum, commonly known as the longflower sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Armeriastrum longiflorum is well adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping.
